This document is prepared in accordance with the provisions of GB/T 1.1 I 202 D.I. Working Guidelines, Part 1: Structure and Drafting Rules of Standardization Documents.

This document replaces GB 18030-2005 “Information technology” Chinese character encoding set. Compared with GB 18030-2005, the main changes in the extension are as follows, apart from structural adjustments and editorial changes:
The scope of this document has been extended (see Chapter 1),

The position of the GB/I 13000 code corresponding to 10 vertical punctuation marks and 8 kanji characters in the byte encoding area has been changed, and in addition to the 6 double-encoded kanji characters and 9 double-encoded kanji characters (see Appendix D, Appendix A of the 2005 edition),
18 GB/T 13000 code positions in the four-byte code area have been changed (see Appendix D, Appendix D of the 2005 edition);
The appendix "Added kanji and kanji roots/parts" was deleted. See the 2005 edition of the appendix 〇,
"Added implementation classes" (see 9th);
Added an informative appendix "General Standard Kanji List; Code Locations of the Diacritics" see appendix 2.
Please note that some of the contents of this document may be patented. The publisher of this document does not take responsibility for identifying patents.
This paper was submitted and answered by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology of the People's Republic of China.
The release history of this document and its successors is as follows:
A-2000 first issued as GB 18030 A 2000, 2005 first revision; This time is the second revision.
Information Expansion Technology
1 This document specifies the hexadecimal representation of Chinese graphic characters and even binary codes for information technology.
This document applies to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input, and output of Chinese and other text-based graphic character information.

This document applies to technical products with the function of information processing and exchange of Chinese and other text graphic characters, including but not limited to software products represented by input method, optical character recognition (OCR), editing proofreading, machine translation, speech synthesis, text transcription, and other, and convenience products represented by computers, communication terminal devices, e-book readers, and learning machines.
2 Explicit references
The following documents constitute essential provisions of this document through their normative references in the text.
For dated references, only the version with that date applies; for undated references, the most recent version (including all revisions) applies.
GB/T 2312-1980 "Set of character codes for information exchange"
GB/I 11383-1989 Information processing â€“ Eight-digit code structure and coding rules for information exchange
GB/T 13000 Information Technology Universal Multi-octal Character Set (UCS)
3 Terms and definitions
The following terms and definitions apply to this document.
3.1 Character character
An element in a set of elements used to organize, control, or represent data.
3.2 Coded character
Characters (3.1) and their encodings are shown.
3.3 User-defined area private use area
Users of products compliant with this document may define their own zones.
3.4 Vocabulary repertoire
A specified character (3.1) set represented by an encoded character (3.2) set.
3.5 Reserved zone
The following are the areas defined in this document.
4 Vocabulary
4.1 Overview
The characters in this file are encoded as single, double, or quad bytes.
The single-byte portion contains the 128 characters from 0x00 to 0x7F of GB/T 11383-1989.
4.3 Byte portion
The double-byte section contains all the graphic characters in GB/T 2312 I 1980, the CJK Unified Kanji in GB/T 13000, and some graphic characters.
The characters in the double-byte portion are as defined in Appendix A.
The graphic, code position and function of the ideographic descriptor shall comply with the provisions of Appendix B.
Note: GB/T 13000 is a standardized code of characters used in China, Japan, Korea, Vietnam and other countries and regions.
A kanji with a unique abstract character form is assigned a separate code position; kanji with different sources but the same abstract character form are assigned a shared code position.
The encoded kanji are called CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK stands for China, Japan, and Korea.
4.4 Quad-byte portion

The quad-byte portion contains the 66 CJK Unified Characters (9FA6 to 9FEF, excluding 8 characters from 9FB4 to 9FBB) in GB/T 13000, CJK Unified Character Extension A, CJK Unified Character Extension BCJK, CJK Unified Character Extension C, CJK Unified Character Extension
The characters in the quad-byte portion are as defined in Appendix C.
5 Overall structure
In the text, numbers preceded by 0x are in hexadecimal, and numbers preceded by no 0x are in decimal.
The encoded numbers in the appendix are in hexadecimal, while the other numbers are in decimal.
The single-byte part uses the coding structure of GB/T 11383-1989, using 0x00~0x7F code points.
The double-word portion uses two eight-bit binary strings to represent a character, with the first byte coded from 0x81 to 0xFE, the last byte coded from 0x40 to 0x7E, and 0x80 to 0xFE, respectively.
The quad-byte portion uses the 0x30 to 0x39 suffixes not used in GB/T 11383 to 1989 as an extension to the two-byte encoding, encoding ranges from 0x81308130 to 0xFE39FE39.

The first character encoding range of a four-byte character is 0x81 to 0xFE; the second character encoding range is 0x30 to 0x39; the third byte encoding range is 0x81 to 0xFE; and the fourth character encoding range is 0x30 to 0x39.
The overall structure and the distribution of the node ranges are shown in Figure 1 and Table 1.
6 Order of characters
6.1 Order of the characters in a single-letter brush
The monogram part characters are arranged in the order of the corresponding characters in GB/I 11383-1989.
6.2 Order of the characters in the double-letter city
The order of the characters in the subsequent part of the double word shall be in accordance with Appendix A.
6.3 Order of the four-letter part characters

The 50400 code bits from 0x81308130 to 0x8439FE39 correspond to all characters of the GB/T 13000 Basic Multilingual Plane not included in the bibyte portion, arranged in the order of the corresponding characters of the GB/T 13000 Basic Multilingual Plane.

From 0x90308130 to 0xE339FE39, 1058400 code bits are used to correspond to the 16 sub-planes of GB/T 13000, and the character order is exactly the same as the code bit order of the 16 sub-planes of GB/I 13000.
The order of the four-byte part characters should be in accordance with Appendix C.

8 Description of some characters and codes
In comparison to GB 18030-1:2005, the lettering on some code positions and/or the corresponding GB/TI 13000 code positions have been adjusted in this document (see Appendix D).
9.1 General
This document specifies three implementation classes.
System software products that meet the respective implementation class shall provide input/output functionality for all characters within the range of the respective implementation class.
9.2 Implementation level 1

Implements the CJK Unified Character (i.e. 0x82358F33 to 0x82359636) and CJK Unified Character Extension A (i.e. 0x8139EE39 to 0x82358738) for the single-byte encoding part, the bi-season encoding part,
Any product to which this document applies should meet the requirements of Implementation Class 1.
Note: Depending on the application, implementation level 1 can also select any one or more non-kanji characters listed in table 3.
9.3 Implementation level 2
Implementation class 2 contains implementation class 1.
In addition, implementation class 2 also supports characters that are not included in implementation class 1.
The code positions and character forms of the kanji in this document are given in the appendix.
System software and supporting software should meet the requirements of implementation level 2.

Note: System software and support software include but are not limited to operating systems, database management systems, and middleware (for information on software product classification, see GB/T 36475).
9.4 Implementation level 3
Implementation class 3 contains implementation class 2.
In addition, the implementation of class 3 also supports all the kanji specified in this document and the kanji initials in table 3.
Products for government and public services should meet the requirements of implementation class 3.

Note: Government services and common services include but are not limited to railway transportation, road transportation, water transportation, air transportation, intermodal transportation and transportation agency, postal services, money and financial services, insurance, land, administration, health, state institutions, social security, etc. (for information on industry classification, see GB/T 4754).

DESCRIPTION C and C++ compilers are integrated. They both use one or more of four steps to process input files: preprocessing, hii (compilation), assembly (assembly), and mere (linking).
The postfix identifies the language of the source file, but for the compiler, the postfix controls the default setting:
gcc assumes the preprocessed file (.i) to be a c file, and sets up a c-like link,
g++ assumes the preprocessed file (.i) to be a c++ file and sets up a c++-like connection.
The filename suffix indicates the language and the subsequent operation:
.c C source code; preprocessing, compilation, lexicalization
.C C++ source code; preprocessing, compilation, lexicalization
.cc C++ source code; preprocessing, compilation, lexicalization
. CXX C++ source code; preprocessing, compilation, lexicalization
.m Objective-C source code; preprocessing, compilation, lexicalization
.i Preprocessed C files; compilation, lexicalization
.ii Preprocessed c++ files; compilation, syntax
.s Lexical language source code; lexical
Lexical language source code; preprocessing, lexicalization
.h preprocessor files; files that do not normally appear on the command line other than postclass names are passed to the linker.
.0 Object file
.a Archive file
Connecting is always the last step unless the -cec, -s, or -E options are used (or a compilation error prevents the complete process).

During the linking phase, all.e files, -1 library files, and unrecognized filenames (including the specified.o H files and.a library files) corresponding to the source program are passed to the OPTIONS connector in the order specified on the command line.
The options must be given separately: de'is completely different from `-d -r '.
Most `-=E :' and `-W' options have two opposite formats: -fname and -fno-name (or -Wname and -Wno-name).
Only formats that are not default are listed here.
Below is a summary of all the options, grouped by type, with explanations placed in the later sections.

In particular, the preprocessor mentioned above, but not the other effects of the `-traditional' option.
-fdollars-in-identifiers Allows the use of `$' characters in identifiers (C++ only).
You can specify the `“-Efno-dollars-in-identifiers' option to indicate that the `$' symbol is not allowed.
(GNU C++ allows the `$' character by default on some target systems, but not all.)
-fenum-int-equiv allows implicit conversion of ant to enumeration (MEF c++).
Normally, GNU C++ allows conversion from enum to int, but not the other way around.
-fexternal-—templates produces smaller code (c++ only) for template declarations by creating a copy of each template function only where they are defined.
To use this option successfully, you must tag all files using the template with `#pragma implementatio' (definition) or `#Pragma interface' (statement).
When compiling a program with `-fexternal-templates ', template instantiation is all external. You must make the required instances appear in the implementation file.
This can be done with typedef, which references each instance as needed.
Correspondingly, if the default `-fno-exteznal-templates' option is used during compilation, all template instances are explicitly set to built-in.
All member functions (except constructor subfunctions and mnew or delete member operators) are treated as pseudofunctions of the class they belong to.
This does not mean that every call to a member function will pass through the internal table of fictitious functions.
In some cases, the compiler can determine that a pseudo function can be called directly; in this case, it calls it directly.
-fcond-mismatch Allows mismatch of the second and third arguments of the conditional expression.
The value of this expression is Void.-fthis-—is-variable allows you to assign a value to this (for c++ only).
The incorporation of user-defined free storage management mechanisms into c++ has made the assignable `this' obsolete.
Therefore, by default, the operation to assign a value to this inside a class member function is invalid.
However, for backward compatibility, you can enable this with the `-fthis-is-variable' option.
-funsigned-char defines char as a non-signed type, like unsigned char.
Each machine has its own default char type. It can be either unsigned char or signed char.
Ideally, when relying on the symbolism of data, a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned chaz.
But many programs are written using just simple char, and the term street is a signed number (or unsigned number, depending on the target machine for which the program is written).
This option, and its opposite option, cause that program to run at the corresponding default value.
The type of a char should always be explicitly defined as either signed char or unsigned char, even if it represents exactly one of them.
If the `signed 'or"unsigned"modifier is not explicitly declared, these options are used to define a bitfield or unsigned bitfield.

By default, positional fields are signed, because they inherit the signed integer type from the basic integer type, such as int, however, if the `-traditional' option is specified, positional fields are always unsigned.
-fwritable-strings stores string constants in writable data blocks, and does not treat them differently.
This is for compatibility with some old programs, which recalculate string constants is a very bad idea, the `-traditional' option has the same effect.
Executive Summary
The COVID-19 Pandemic and the Drug Market
The impact could be similar to the 2008 financial crisis.
The global COVID-19 pandemic has plunged the world into an unprecedented crisis.
In many countries, the disease has overwhelmed health-care systems to the point of collapse, and government restrictions have disrupted the global economy.
The impact of the pandemic on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could be far-reaching.
Some producers may be forced to look for new ways to manufacture drugs, as restrictions on movement also limit access to precursors and essential chemicals.
Traffickers who are unable to cross borders due to travel restrictions may have to look for new routes and methods.
Patterns of drug use and supply may change, and governments' ability to respond may be hampered.
The shift brought by COVID-19 is unprecedented, but there are lessons to be learned from past crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some drug users began to look for cheaper synthetic substances, and their use patterns shifted to injecting drugs.
At the same time, governments cut drug-related budgets.
If governments respond to the current economic downturn in the same way, interventions to prevent drug use and related risky behaviour, and drug treatment services, could be severely affected.
In addition, the priority of interception and international cooperation may be reduced, making it easier for traffickers to move.
Countries with large amounts of drugs smuggled through commercial flights are expected to be most directly affected by drug trafficking.

Couriers carry synthetic drugs such as methamphetamine in handbags or hidden in personal luggage, sometimes in large quantities.With restrictions on air passenger transport imposed almost everywhere, the use of commercial air travel to supply drugs may be completely disrupted.
Despite the disruption of international postal supply chains, the use of dark web and freight mail for trafficking is likely to increase.
In the long run, economic recession and related closures may disrupt the drug market.

With rising unemployment and lack of opportunities, poor and vulnerable people are more likely to use drugs in harmful ways, develop drug-related disorders, and turn to illicit activities related to drugs, whether production or transportation.
Drug trafficking organizations may take advantage of this situation to provide services to vulnerable populations and recruit new members to grow their ranks.
As government capacity to respond decreases, these shifts are likely to take root rapidly, becoming new realities in many communities.
Expansion and complexity
Market growth
And the population pattern explains part of the market expansion.
Drug use is increasing worldwide, both in terms of overall numbers and as a proportion of the world's population.
An estimated 210 million people used drugs in 2009, or 4.8% of the global population aged 15–64, compared to an estimated 269 million people in 2018, or 5.3% of that population.
Over the past two decades, drug use has grown much faster in developing countries than in developed countries.

This reflects partly the difference in overall population growth over the period, 7% in developed countries and 28% in developing countries, but also reflects the faster growth of younger populations in developing countries.
Adolescents and young adults account for the largest proportion of drug users.
Between 2000 and 2018, the population of this age group in developing countries grew by 16%, while it decreased by 10% in developed countries.
1 Urbanization is a driver of the current and future drug markets
In both developed and developing countries, urban areas are more affected than rural areas.

The overall increase in drug use is partly due to the large-scale migration of people from rural to urban areas. More than half of the world's population now lives in urban areas, up from 34 per cent in 1960.
Urbanization may be a key factor in future drug market dynamics, especially in developing countries where urbanization is more pronounced.
Increased wealth is associated with increased drug use, but the burden of the disease is borne by the poorest. Drug use is more prevalent in developed countries than in developing countries.
Drugs such as cocaine are strongly associated with the wealthier regions of the world.
Similarly, within countries, drug use is more prevalent among the wealthy.
However, the rate of people who develop substance abuse disorders is higher among those of lower socio-economic status.
Data from a few countries suggest that there is a link between harmful drug use patterns and illness and low income.
These patterns appear to be less common in wealthier social classes.
The economic constraints imposed by the global COVID-19 crisis are likely to exacerbate the risks for the most vulnerable, including drug users.
For example, changes in the labor market, such as rising unemployment, have been linked to increases in drug use, and the pandemic has already forced tens of millions of people worldwide out of work.

The COVID-19 pandemic may lead to more farmers growing or engaging in illicit crop cultivation, either because of the reduced ability of national authorities to control it, or because more people may be forced to take risks and engage in illegal activities under the economic crisis.
The decline in air and land trafficking due to COVID-19 restrictions may have increased trafficking by sea, which is less likely to be intercepted and more likely to be smuggled than by air or land.
Recently, there have been reports of cocaine cargoes being shipped directly from South America to Europe by sea.
Complexity enhancement
The emergence of non-internationally controlled substances is stable, but new opioids with potential harm are proliferating and the drug market is becoming increasingly complex.
Hundreds of synthetic drugs, many of which are not under international control, have been added to the list, along with plant-based substances such as cannabis, cocaine, and heroin.
About 500 new active substances are introduced to the domestic markets of member countries each year.
Most of these are stimulants, followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a small number of opioids.
While the overall number of new psychoactive substances has stabilized, the proportions have changed.
Of the total number of new psychoactive substances identified in 2014, opioid-type new psychoactive substances accounted for only 2%, but by 2018, that figure had risen to 9%.

Many of the new opioid psychoactive substances are fentanyl analogues, whose efficacy and harmfulness have been demonstrated, leading to overdose deaths in North America and to a lesser extent in other regions.
In North America, fentanyl is used as a compound in heroin and other drugs, including cocaine and methamphetamine, and in the manufacture of counterfeit pharmaceutical opioids.

Some evidence suggests that the phenomenon of injecting NSA stimulants is also occurring in Europe: a study of discarded syringe residues in six European cities found that many syringes were contaminated with NSAs that produce stimulant effects.
2. New psychoactive substance use may be becoming more pervasive in vulnerable populations
A single class of new psychoactive substances rarely forms a large market.
But evidence from Europe suggests that synthetic cannabis is a serious problem among marginalized groups such as the homeless and prison inmates.
Twenty-two countries reported the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons, with most countries identifying synthetic cannabinoids as the main challenge.

Control of precursor chemicals has forced drug manufacturers to innovate. Many chemicals that are most commonly used as precursors to synthesize drugs such as amphetamine, methamphetamine and "shabu" have been placed under international control.
Drug traffickers and producers have been looking for alternatives, not only less controlled substances, but also chemicals specifically designed to circumvent controls, known as "custom precursors".
Restrictive measures aimed at halting the spread of COVID-19 are likely to put further pressure on drug producers who rely on precursor chemicals.

Evidence from Mexico suggests that this is already a reality: in March 2020, shortages of methamphetamine precursors imported from East Asia reportedly drove up methamphetamine prices in Mexico and the United States.
The market is very dynamic.
Synthetic drugs replace opioids in Central Asia and the Russian Federation
The opioid market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appears to have changed between 2008 and 2018.
The amount of opioids intercepted by Russian authorities has dropped by about 80%, and the number of people receiving treatment for opioid use has dropped dramatically.
But the stimulant market seems to be booming.
There is evidence that methamphetamine and various cathinones, including mephedrone and a-pyrroloquinoline quinone, are now ubiquitous on the Russian drug market.
Russian authorities reported a sharp increase in the number of recently discovered clandestine laboratories manufacturing various illicit drugs, more than doubling in two years to 152 in 2018.
Growth in methamphetamine markets in Afghanistan and Iraq
As early as 2012, surveys of staff in hospitals, prisons and other institutions revealed the importance of methamphetamine in Iraq.
Crystalline methamphetamine has become another major drug of concern alongside fentanyl and tramadol.
A 2015 study further confirmed these findings, with users reporting that cannabis was more difficult to obtain than "phenethylamine" or methamphetamine.

Recently, the Iraqi authorities discovered several methamphetamine processing sites, and the Board has expressed concern about the import of large quantities of pseudoephedrine preparations, which are used as precursors in a methamphetamine processing site.
In Afghanistan, methamphetamine manufacture appears to have begun in 2014.
Since then, seizures of methamphetamine have been steadily increasing.
But the first half of 2019 saw a record 657 kilograms of heroin seized – a sharp increase from the previous year.
Large seizures of methamphetamine believed to originate in Afghanistan in other countries also indicate that production in that country is rapidly increasing.
Policy changes and trends
Most jurisdictions that have legalized non-medical cannabis use have seen cannabis use increase.
Eleven jurisdictions in Canada, Uruguay and the United States allow the manufacture of cannabis products for non-medical use.
In most of these jurisdictions, cannabis use has increased since legalization, although similar trends have been observed in other jurisdictions that have not legalized non-medical use of cannabis.

In Colorado and Washington, the two states that first passed legislation, non-medical use of cannabis by adults has increased, especially in the past month and daily or almost daily use, and has exceeded the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that cannabis use in Uruguay has increased since 2011, with use almost doubling in the past month.
This suggests that the increase is mainly due to frequent and frequent use of cannabis.
Short-term data from Canada also show that the legal market expanded in 2018 and 2019, and that usage increased.
However, 40% of cannabis users still obtained some products from illegal sources in 2019.
Is the reason behind the global cannabis seizures plummet legalization of cannabis?
Global cannabis herb seizures fell to their lowest level in 20 years in 2018, driven by a decline in North America, which has seen seizures drop by 84% over the past 10 years.

In contrast, seizures in other parts of the world almost doubled during the same period.The pattern of seizures suggests that policies aimed at liberalizing the cannabis market played a key role in the decline.
Regulation of new psychoactive substances appears to have a deterrent effect.
Countries with different regulatory regimes for new psychoactive substances show different prevalence rates of use of new psychoactive substances.
In other countries, the use of new psychoactive substances has decreased following the adoption of national legislation.
Vulnerable groups face harm from both the legal and illegal drug markets.
In 2018, more than 90% of all pharmaceutical opioids available for medical consumption were in high-income countries.
About 50% are in North America, 40% in Europe, and 2% in Oceania.
These countries account for about 12% of the world's population.
It is estimated that while low- and middle-income countries account for 88% of the world's population, they consume less than 10% of the world's medical opioids.
Barriers to access to medical opioids are related to many factors, including legislation, culture, health systems, and prescription practices.
People who are poorer are at greater risk of drug use disorders, with an estimated 35.6 million people suffering from drug use disorders in 2018.

Poverty, limited education and social marginalization may increase the risk of drug use disorders and exacerbate their consequences.Studies in high-income countries confirm this, in which individuals' unfavourable socioeconomic trajectories are not only related to their situation at a given time, but also to the risk of drug use disorders.

Drug-related disorders also deepen socioeconomic disadvantage, further increasing the risk of unemployment, poverty, and homelessness, thereby fuelling a vicious circle of disadvantage.These outcomes may also be related to stigmatization and consequences within the criminal justice system.

Women, ethnic minorities and migrants, people with a diverse sexual orientation, people displaced by armed conflict or disaster, and people in rural settings may also be disproportionately affected by drug-related disorders or have problems accessing treatment services.

The impact of harmful drug use on society at large has increased over the past decade, according to the Disability-Adjusted Life Year (DALY) index, which estimates the number of years of healthy life lost due to disability and premature death.
Between 2007 and 2018, the global disability-adjusted life expectancy attributable to drug use increased by 17%.
The increase in disability-adjusted life expectancy associated with liver cancer due to untreated hepatitis C, which is common among injecting drug users, is particularly high—up to 40%.
The relationship between drugs and violence is complex and it is difficult to determine all the causal links between the use of psychoactive substances and violence.
Limited data on a global scale suggest that intoxication may be an important factor in homicide.
But alcohol seems to play a bigger role than drugs in violence.

While drug use may lead to crime, in some cases this association can be partly attributed to a variety of mediating factors, such as socioeconomic disadvantage and other types of adversity caused by personal risk, family environment, and peer influence.
The link between drug trafficking and violence is multifaceted.
Large-scale organized crime, including international drug trafficking, can be carried out without violence where stable criminal structures exist.

In the short term, the existence and degree of violence depends less on the volume of trafficking than on certain changes that destabilize the balance of power between organized crime groups, such as changes in the size of the illicit market, the death or imprisonment of prominent criminals, and law enforcement measures that weaken one group over another.
Latest trends
Cannabis is the most commonly used substance, opioids are the most harmful
It is estimated that 192 million people used cannabis in 2018, making it the most widely used drug worldwide.
In contrast, 58 million people used opioids in 2018.
But the harm associated with opioids is overlooked because of the small number of users.

Of the estimated 167,000 deaths related to drug use disorders in 2017, 66% were attributed to these substances, and 50% of the 21 million life years believed to be lost due to disability or premature death from drug use.
The non-medical use of synthetic opioids is adding to the public health crisis.

In West, Central and North Africa, the opioid crisis is fueled by tramadol; in North America, by fentanyl.The two regions have little in common in terms of economics, demographics, or general drug use patterns, but are struggling with an opioid crisis fueled by substances that are easily available and cheap to produce.
In North America, the use of synthetic opioids such as fentanyl has led to an increase in opioid overdose deaths over the past 20 years.
In 2018, two-thirds of the 67,367 overdose deaths recorded in the United States were related to fentanyl.
Canada reported similar results, but in lower numbers.
The overdose deaths from fentanyl are partly due to the unpredictable effects of fentanyl on the illicit drug market.
In West, Central and North Africa, the market for non-medical tramadol has grown significantly.
In the region, the number of patients receiving treatment for tramadol use disorders is increasing.
In 2017, the number of tramadol intercepted worldwide increased significantly, reaching a peak of more than 125 tons.
But in 2018, after India passed a new law to regulate tramadol, global seizures dropped to 32 tons.
The crisis in both countries was fueled by the ease and low cost of manufacture, as well as the lack of international regulation of tramadol and many fentanyl analogues or their precursors.
The crisis in both countries is compounded by the fact that these substances are available both on the pharmaceutical and the illicit markets, making their abuse more difficult to detect and prevent.
Stimulant use is on the rise.
The stimulant sector is dominated by cocaine and methamphetamine, both of which are increasing in their primary markets.
About 19 million people used cocaine in 2018, with the highest prevalence in North America and Western Europe.
Amphetamine was used by about 27 million people in the same year, with methamphetamine being the most commonly used amphetamine stimulant in Southeast Asia and North America.
According to most available indicators, methamphetamine use has been expanding in both regions over the past 20 years.

In some markets, cocaine and methamphetamine coexist, sometimes substituting for each other, so that the increase in one drug use decreases the use of the other, sometimes simultaneously increasing and decreasing to meet the demand of the same market.
COVID-19 increases risks for injecting drug users
It is estimated that approximately 11.3 million people injected drugs in 2018, accounting for about 10% of global HIV infections.
More than 1 million injecting drug users are infected with HIV, and 5.5 million with hepatitis C.
In 2017, approximately 585,000 people died from drug use, half of them from liver disease caused by hepatitis C, which remains largely untreated among injecting drug users.
5 Opioid shortages caused by COVID-19 restrictions may lead users to substitute more readily available substances such as alcohol or benzodiazepines, or to mix opioids with synthetic drugs.
More harmful uses may emerge as some users switch to injecting or inject more frequently.

EU summit to discuss refugee policy, EU officials: the reception process step by step bottleneck-China News Network
EU summit debates refugee policy, EU officials say bottlenecks at every step of reception process

According to the AFP, on February 10, at the latest EU summit, European Commission President Von der Leyen said that EU leaders agreed to introduce stricter policies on illegal immigration, making it easier to expel illegal immigrants.
The move is reportedly a response to growing concerns about illegal immigration in Europe, where the core problem is that few illegal immigrants are eventually returned.
According to the summit document, EU leaders called on the Commission to "immediately mobilise significant EU funds" to strengthen external borders with infrastructure and surveillance.
However, the EU and its member states have been at loggerheads over the payment of the fence.
Von der Leyen repeatedly stated that EU funds would not cover the costs.

But some EU member states' diplomats say that if the EU could share the cost of installing cameras, watchtowers and other infrastructure along the external borders, it would free up national budgets and speed up construction.

According to Euractiv, EU officials acknowledged that bottlenecks exist at every step of the refugee reception process, that limited reception capacity and overburdened immigration authorities in member states are unable to prevent refugees from filing "innumerable" asylum applications in EU countries, and that the EU's refugee reception system is in an almost "permanent crisis".
According to the European Commission, the Schengen countries received more than 920,000 asylum applications last year, almost half the number of the previous year.
Meanwhile, the EU recorded over 330,000 illegal entry cases last year.
In this context, the summit also agreed on a "principle" that EU countries can repatriate illegal immigrants based on a court ruling in another member state.
In addition, the report said, EU leaders agreed to "increase the use of the safe country concept", which would open the way for the EU to develop a common list.
(Source: Global Times Author: Yu Ruifei)

In recent years, the U.S. has been unremittingly fighting China's "core" development, while simultaneously cracking down on China's semiconductor supply chain and building a semiconductor industry chain alliance to "de-Chineseize" China, attempting to completely "slip" China off the advanced semiconductor industry.

Whether it is by drawing South Korea into a “technology alliance,” or by establishing a “quadrilateral chip alliance” with South Korea, Japan, and China-Taiwan, or by establishing a “small circle” of semiconductor industry chains through the “quadrilateral mechanism” and “Indo-Pacific economic framework” of the US, Japan, India, Australia, and other countries, the US is attempting to build
However, the US's "core tactics" against China, which are widely touted, are also "one thousand injuries, eight hundred losses."

The first batch of personal pension products is on sale, the minimum can only hold 360 days-CNN
First pension products launched
You can choose from seven products from the same institution, and you can only hold them for 360 days.
Personal retirement savings products are finally online.

On February 10, China Funding Network released the first list of personal retirement account products, and seven personal retirement account products of Industrial Bank of China, Agricultural Bank of China and China Postal Bank of China were officially sold.

The "shelves" of the personal pension accounts now include four categories of products: personal pension savings, personal pension investment, personal pension insurance, and personal pension publicly traded funds.

According to the introduction, the first batch of personal retirement savings products, all of them are publicly traded net value open-ended products, among which 5 new products, 2 existing products, except for 1 product for mixed products, the remaining 6 products are fixed income products.

The Beijing Youth Newspaper reports that four of the five new products are from Industrial Bank of China, all of which are fixed-income products with minimum holding periods of 365, 540, 720 and 1,080 days, and corresponding benchmarks (annualized) of 3.70% to 4.20%, 4.10% to 4.60%, 4

The remaining new product is "Postal Bank Wealth-Adding-Hong-Nick Minimum Hold 1095 Days 1 No.", also a fixed-income product, which began to be collected on February 10 and ended on February 19, with a risk rating of second.
One of the two existing products is the 360-day technology-innovative RMB investment product "Nongbin Tongxin and Lingting", which is a hybrid investment product with a risk rating of three.

Another existing product is "Postal Bank Wealth Add-on Hong-Jin Minimum Hold 365 Days 1 No.", fixed income type, started last December 30, officially operated on January 4, February 8, the cumulative net value of 1.0011.

According to the State Council Office's Opinion on the Promotion of Personal Pension Funds, the financial products that can be invested with the funds in the personal pension fund account include bank savings, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, and publicly traded funds.
The first batch of personal retirement savings products is sold, marking the official launch of the purchase of retirement savings products through personal retirement savings funds accounts.
Last November, the BBSRC issued the Interim Procedures for the Management of Personal Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Investment Companies.

The Regulations stipulate that participants may purchase personal retirement savings, personal retirement savings products, personal retirement insurance products, and publicly traded pension fund products through the personal retirement funds account.

The Ministry of Human Resources and Social Welfare, the Ministry of Finance and the National Tax Administration issued a notice stating that the personal pension system would be implemented in Beijing, Tianjin, Shijiazhuang, Chong'an New District, and Jin City in Hebei and Shanxi, among 36 other cities and regions.

By the end of 2022, the number of individual pension participants will be 19.54 million, the number of contributors will be 6.13 million, and the total amount of contributions will be 142 billion yuan.

Previously, the banks participating in the pilot project only offered three types of products: personal retirement savings, personal retirement insurance products, and publicly traded personal retirement funds.
Now, after the personal retirement products also gathered, how should investors choose?

Experts from the Research and Development Department of the CIBC said that compared to other personal retirement products, the pilot phase of retirement products and personal retirement products have three characteristics.
The first is robustness, with more robust risk management mechanisms, more robust investment strategies and philosophy, and independent custodianship by a non-mother bank.

Second, long-term, the term of the pilot phase retirement savings products is 5 years and more, the next step of the issue of personal retirement savings products, the minimum holding period is in principle 1 year, and encourages holding for more than 3 years.

Third, the universality, the product purchase threshold is low, starting point is generally 1 yuan, some as low as 0.01 yuan, the product of custody fee, management fee and other rates are more favorable.
Professionals point out that investors should choose according to the characteristics of the product and their own risk tolerance.

Personal pension savings have a longer term, higher interest rate, high security features, suitable for people with low risk-bearing capacity; personal pension insurance products are more in the protection, more suitable for people who can not bear the investment risk, can accept stable returns; and personal pension investment products and public funds products do not guarantee the capital and does not guarantee the return, has certain investment risk, but the expected return is higher, suitable for people with certain

The fitness industry should get rid of the crisis of trust-China News Service
Another large gym "lightning strike"?
Recently, the rights of members of well-known fitness institutions have attracted social attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that their stores were not operating normally, and rumors about the closure of the runway caused panic among members, leading to the intervention of the public security and human resources departments.
Finally, the responsible persons of the institution responded, and promised to work hard to safeguard the legal rights and interests of the employees and members, and the storm was calmed.

Some of the individual fitness institution shops appearing operating problems, temporarily closed, consumers could be calm and wait for the problem to be solved, why many members' first reaction is "big bad thing"?
Behind the storm of fitness club members' rights, there is a deep-seated crisis of confidence in the industry.
The traditional gyms in China generally adopt prepaid payment model, "earn money that users do not come" is the bottom logic of its development.
Through pre-sale membership card to obtain cash flow, open new stores, seemingly able to cycle back and forth, in fact, the sun eats the moon, can not form a stable profit model.
Negative information about the industry, such as gyms and jogging tracks, is spreading frequently, causing a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From the market perspective, the gym is of course a good business with "money".
The fitness track, although it has been up and down, has always been the focus of capital.
Several data points out that the market is continuously warming up, with the heat of the fields such as literary style consumption continuously rising.

Specifically to the fitness market, with the steady improvement of the living standard of the population, the concept of healthy living deeply in the heart of people, the development of the fitness industry has much to do.
The better the situation, the more the industry needs to focus on the quality of development.

However, individual institutions are blindly optimistic about the fitness market after the recovery of consumption, just out of the crisis, and blowing the horn of the frontier, the financing funds a brain invested in the construction of new stores.

It is undeniable that in recent years, affected by the pandemic, many institutions have withdrawn, the industry has re-arranged, and powerful companies have selectively increased their purchases and rearranged, which is not a new opportunity.
However, the fitness market development to enter a virtuous circle, to move forward steady and far Kangzhuang Avenue, the industry must change the traditional model, change the strategy.
Only by steadily rebuilding consumer confidence and security can we truly win the market and the future.
Compared to the construction of new stores to capture the market, the fitness industry currently more need to focus on improving service, high quality development to stabilize users.
First, you need to retain users with your service.
Gyms belong to the service industry, the essence is to adhere to "user-oriented", to closely surround user needs, to focus on the service quality upgrade.
Second, digital transformation to improve user experience.
For example, the popular Internet gym model, which allows users to pay by the time and choose the location.
At the same time, the body data, exercise data can be effectively used, and can meet the social needs, realize the complete service loop from online to offline.
No private tutor marketing, no high-value annual card, users' concerns about fitness institutions "running" is reduced, and the confidence is also increased.
In addition, we must actively explore the diversity of industries.

Today, sports consumption has moved from a single service to the consumption of the scene, fitness club is expected to become a new entry point for consumption, around the fitness required exercise supplies and fitness equipment and other peripheral products or will become a new profit point, providing consumers with more choice.

Taiwan's economy starts 2012 with a slump

Xinhua News Agency/Taipei Feb. 11 (Zhao Bo, Huang Yang) Export trade volume is “black for the fifth month in a row”, the manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) has contracted for seven consecutive months, and the consumer price index (CPI) has again reached “3-digit” levels.
Experts believe that the Taiwanese economy has not performed well in the beginning of the year, and that the growth pressure is not small.
According to the Taiwan Ministry of Finance, exports from Taiwan region amounted to US$31.51 billion in January, down 21.2% year-on-year, the fifth consecutive month of negative growth.
Exports of 11 major export goods categories fell compared to the same period last year.
Plastic rubber and its products and optical equipment fell the most, down 37.6% and 35.7% year-on-year, respectively.
Exports of electronic components fell by 20.1% year-on-year, the largest decline in 11 years.
Integrated circuits fell by 18.3% year-on-year, the biggest decline in 14 years.

According to the head of the department's statistics department, Tsai Min-na, this indicates that the weakness of consumer electronics industry demand spreads, and the electronics industry enters the revision period.
Statistics show that in January, Taiwan's exports and imports fell, and the surplus was only 2.34 billion dollars, the lowest level in the last three years.

The Taiwan Ministry of Finance believes that global end-user demand is declining, industry adjustment inventories are dampening manufacturers' willingness to purchase, and exports are unlikely to improve in the short term.

According to the Taiwan Institute of Chinese Economics, the seasonally adjusted Taiwan manufacturing PMI fell 3.3 percentage points to 40.4 in January, down from 40.7 in December, and contracting for seven consecutive months.
In the economic monitoring indicator system, the PMI is 50% as the line of prosperity, the index is greater than 50%, indicating economic expansion, contraction.
In January, the five components of the Taiwan PMI indicated that new orders, production and employment contracted, suppliers' delivery times declined, and inventories contracted.

All six major industries reported PMI contraction, with the following industries in order of contraction rate: power and machinery (35.1%), electronics and optics (35.2%), chemicals and biotechnology (39.2%), raw materials (42.4%), transportation (42.6%), and food and textiles (45.7%).
In terms of prices, the Central Bureau of Statistics announced that the annual rate of inflation in Taiwan was 3.04% in January, the highest since July last year.
Among them, vegetable prices jumped 28.25%, reaching a 17-month high.
According to the National Bureau of Statistics, the average CPI in January and February should be close to the 2.71% in December, and inflation pressure still exists and is still high.
Looking ahead to this year's Taiwan economy, experts expressed pessimism, according to reports in the mainland media such as the Associated Press and Yahoo Finance.

Professor Wu Dai-ming of the Department of Economics at Central University of Taiwan said that the slowdown in exports could cause cash flow problems for exporting manufacturers, and the risk of default on debt could rise.
At the same time, the decline in orders has led manufacturers to cut labor costs, affecting the labor market and household budgets, which in turn impacts consumer spending.

According to Taiwan Economic Research Institute researcher Dasheng Cui, the European and American inflation situation is not resolved this year, demand continues to shrink, and the decline in Taiwan's exports is expected to continue in the first half of the year.
As the Taiwanese economy is supported by exports, the economic growth performance for the whole year will be weaker than last year, affected by the sluggish exports.

"China's economy has shown great resilience in dealing with the COVID-19 pandemic.

Report: Number of Chinese students returning to China to seek jobs will reach new high in 2022-China News Service
Top 10 countries for foreign students to study in 2022 Source: China Overseas Employment Survey Report 2022

CSINFO.COM (Beijing, February 11, 2022) -- The 2022 China Overseas Employment Survey Report (hereinafter referred to as the "Report") recently released by Menrui shows that the number of overseas students in 2022 increased by 8.6% year-on-year, and the number of overseas students looking for jobs in China set a new high
The report noted that since 2020, the number of returnees seeking jobs in China has increased significantly, and the number of returning students seeking jobs has increased.
Compared to 2021, the number of international students in 2022 will increase by 8.6% year-on-year, and the number of international students returning to China to seek employment will set a new high.

The UK accounted for the largest share of the total number of students returning to China to study abroad, at 41.4%, followed by Australia (20.3%) and the United States (9%), in line with the ranking in 2021.
In terms of year-on-year growth, the number of students from Malaysia, Japan and Singapore in 2022 will increase significantly year-on-year, with growth rates of 66.1%, 50.9% and 37.7% respectively.
The number of students from Canada, Germany, the United States and Australia dropped year-on-year.
Source: "2022 China Overseas Employment Survey Report"

The survey showed that 58% of foreign students who decided to return to China thought that "life in China was more convenient", 40% thought that they "better recognized the Chinese cultural environment", 32% thought that "there were more employment opportunities in China", and 22% thought that domestic economic activity would accelerate and more employment opportunities would be created.
The data show that the demand for overseas talents by domestic companies is rapidly releasing, and the demand for overseas talents is rising.

In the first week after the Spring Festival of 2023, the number of priority jobs for returnees and the number of returnees seeking jobs in China are both up. The number of priority jobs for returnees on February 3 increased by 11% compared to January 28, and the number of returnees seeking jobs increased by 27%.

In terms of sectors, the number of jobs from education/training sectors accounted for 27.8% of the priority jobs for HRW in 2022, taking first place, followed by professional services/consultancy and Internet/e-commerce with 14.3% and 11.1% respectively.
Changes in the number of overseas Chinese returnees seeking jobs in China in recent years Source: China Overseas Employment Survey Report 2022

From the point of view of wages, the average salary of the priority positions for returnees from abroad has risen for three consecutive years, reaching 14,680 yuan/month (RMB) in 2022, up 961 yuan or 7% from 13,719 yuan/month in 2021.

By geographical area, the willingness of the repatriates to go to new first-line cities, second-line cities and third-line and below cities in 2022 has increased, with the share of 31%, 15.7% and 14.3% in 2022, respectively, higher than the share in 2021.
52.7% of returnees said that their return from studying abroad was in line with their expectations, an increase of 2.8 percentage points from the previous year (49.9%).
28.2% of returnees said they were expecting more or much more than expected, up from 25.4% in 2021.
(Concluded)

Henan Province Rules Integrated Oral Implant Medical Service Prices-China News Network
The implant is a dental device that replaces a missing tooth or teeth, and is often used to replace a missing tooth or teeth.
Since this year, with the acceleration of the implant tooth collection, the implant price reduction in various places on the agenda.

From February 10, Henan Province single regular dental implant medical service price full-process control target of 4300 yuan, single regular implant full-process cost is not higher than 97% of the control target.
Dental implantation refers to a method of restoring missing teeth by supporting and fixing the upper dental restoration body on the basis of the implanted lower structure in the bone tissue.
According to the first branch hospital of Zhengzhou University, the cost of a single implant from implantation to final repair is about 16,000 to 70,000 yuan.
Patient: After the new policy, the doctor told me that in my case, the cost would be about 8,000 yuan or less than 10,000 yuan, basically saving half.

On the basis of the existing projects, Henan Province also integrated and determined 15 oral implant medical service price items such as "implant implant fee (single)" and unified the provincial public health institutions price and health insurance payment categories, and cancelled or adjusted 20 medical service price items such as dental implant implantation.

Zhengzhou City Health Insurance Bureau Pharmacy Price and Tender Procurement Department Director Li Yunjie: The main benefits are four sides, one is health insurance, health insurance expenditure is less; the hospital occupation is less, the patient will increase appropriately; for suppliers, it has a market; for us, the patient is the biggest profit, the cost of a tooth implant may be halved or more.
Shenzhen: Creating the first in China and world-leading ultra-fast pioneer city-China News Service

CSIN News Agency, February 11, 2018 According to the “Shenzhen Industrial News” public account on Weibo, the Shenzhen City Bureau of Industry and Information Technology recently issued the “Shenzhen City Action Plan for the Construction of High-Speed Pioneer City”.

It proposes to build a high-speed, high-capacity, low-latency super-broadband network by the end of 2023, to achieve the goal of "two gigabytes, full-light network, 1 millisecond, multi-object connection" network construction, and to create the first in the country and the world's leading ultra-fast pioneer city.
The plan proposes to accelerate the upgrade of the gigabit optical network.
By the end of 2023, the 10G PON ports will reach 100%, and the number of Zhongguang industrial parks (industrial parks) will exceed 100.
The plan requires comprehensive improvement of 5G network energy efficiency.
Research and development of Shenzhen 5G network service quality standards, conduct 5G network testing and evaluation, and improve 5G network service quality.

Support basic telecommunications companies to increase the optimization of the priority areas, places 5G network, the year added 10000 new 5G base stations, the average download speed reaches 500Mbps, upload speed reaches 100Mbps, the priority area download speed reaches 1000Mbps, upload speed reaches 200Mbps, network speed and user experience is
The goal is to create a high-quality wireless local area network at the city level.

Developing public wireless local area network (WLAN) service standards, promoting WLAN upgrade in areas with high population density and high information consumption demands throughout the city, and providing gigabit access capacity.

The city commissioned “Shenzhen i-net” to build a unified certification and supervision platform for the public wireless local area network, to realize “one-time certification, no-feeling roaming, intelligent switching”, and to support operators to include self-built APs (wireless access points) with public service capability in the certification and supervision platform.
By the end of 2023, the total number of upgraded access points will be no less than 20,000.

In addition, the plan also proposes to build a high-quality optical power network, build a multi-level computing power supply system, accelerate the construction of key communication network facilities, and improve the capacity of Internet application services.
The plan is clear, to cooperate in building a connected sensory system.

The company will explore the construction and management model of city-level sensor terminals based on the open-source Hongmeng operating system, reduce the connection costs, accelerate the construction of city-level IoT sensor platforms, and promote the interconnection of city-level IoT platforms and professional IoT platforms in various fields.

Deepening the application of connected sensing in the fields of urban management, public welfare services, public safety, and traffic travel, and expanding the collection channels of fixed sensing such as urban roads, buildings, and public facilities, and mobile sensing such as smart connected cars.
By the end of 2023, the number of water, electricity and gas IoT sensing terminals will exceed 9 million, and 20 multi-functional smart pole application demonstration projects will be created.

The plan also mentions strengthening the application of satellite and ground communications integration, laying out the construction of low-altitude network infrastructure, and promoting deep coverage of 5G network at sea.

At the same time, it will promote deep coverage of 5G networks at sea, build an ecosystem for the development of industry innovation, and support the organization of top-level competitions and activities.
(China News Service)
China e-commerce industry emerging "new variables", how to make the "content to be king"?
China News Service.
China News Service, February 11, 2017 Subject: China's e-commerce industry is emerging "new variables", how to make the "content king"?
1. China News Service Financial Reporter, Sharbin
"We entered the e-commerce industry late, but we knew from the start that content was important to stand out from the thousands of stores.
"90-year-old Fan Fan from Guangdong now runs a food supplement store on e-commerce platform Twitch, allowing an offline store with a history of more than 30 years to "flower" online".
Imit the old Hong Kong film soundtrack, with classic Cantonese songs, open @ Fan Fan one-man-eating Twitch account, beautiful video refreshing.

In the recent e-commerce Twitch "Search for a fellow traveler, quality content sharing session," Fan Fan as a representative of quality creator spoke, introduced the experience and experience of daily creation.

She said on the spot: "The polished video garnered a lot of attention from netizens, many people are interested in my family's ingredients, want to follow me to make food, and the sales road suddenly opened.

Fan Fan made more people fall in love with "Old Guang's flavor" by cooking soup videos, and a live broadcast sold up to 300,000 items of nutritious food, saving the old store in the family that was about to close.
"No content, no e-commerce", with the development of short video and live e-commerce, people's demands and standards for e-commerce content is entering a new phase.
In the early days of live delivery, the live room often attracted users with low-price discounts, and the price advantage seemed to be the only selling point at the time.

In recent years, there are both Liu Minghong, Eastern selection and other phenomenal big V, and there are many unfamiliar experts and businesses in the vertical segmentation field, they continue to create quality content that matches their brand tone, improve long-term operating efficiency.

According to Gao Achen, the head of the e-commerce star authors of Twitch, 6.27 million content creators have made their content available through Twitch e-commerce in the past year, and their content creation volume has increased by 252%, and the total sales amount has more than doubled.
"Behind these numbers, we can sense a thriving and vibrant author ecosystem.
"Kayahan".

The Beijing Normal University Communication Innovation and Future Media Experiment Platform previously released the E-commerce Industry Content Ecosystem Health Index (ECHI) report, analyzing the importance of the "new variable" - high-quality content in the current e-commerce industry from the data dimension, and using the index to evaluate the content ecosystem situation of 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the above report, the e-commerce industry content ecological health index ranking, Twitch e-commerce, Alibaba, Taobao, Alibaba, and Kyoto ranked in the top five.

The report found that e-commerce industry content ecosystem is a comprehensive concept, is to integrate e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce, good PGC (professional production content) and UGC (user-generated content) is the quality carrier with e-commerce integration, the higher the value of content platform, consumption and promotion of the scene is increasingly rich, the possibility of e-commerce implant

Professor Yu Guoming, Professor of the School of Journalism and Communication at Beijing Normal University and Chairman of the China Media Economics and Management Professional Committee, gave an analysis and explanation of the report.

He said that in terms of content value, the current e-commerce industry has transitioned from "consumption accessibility" to "consumption quality" stage, quality, professional, differentiated content is the e-commerce industry "hard currency".

At the same time, content has become the foundation and the handle of the new stage of e-commerce development, and PGC content such as knowledge payment, professional knowledge, and KOL (Key Opinion Leader) has become the standard in e-commerce live broadcasts.
Looking ahead to the future development of e-commerce industry, Yu Guoming made two recommendations.

One is from the point of view of content structure improvement, to promote the overall improvement of e-commerce content eco-health level and quality, create positive content creation and management standards, and achieve e-commerce industry content eco-health system index and dynamic balance.
The other is to realize the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value collaboration and co-creation of the external environment from the external ecology.

"The future e-commerce industry also needs more data and artificial intelligence support, forming a forecast for future development stability; In addition, provide more standards, healthy growth space for businesses, realize the value collaboration of enterprises, users, products and services in the e-commerce industry, and create a healthy content ecosystem.

Chinese rescue team continues rescue operation in Turkey, rescued four trapped people - China News Network

CSINFO.com (China News Service) -- On February 10, the Chinese rescue team in Turkey sent three operational teams and 45 rescue personnel to rescue one trapped person, the website of the Ministry of Emergency Management reported.
Two search and evaluation teams were sent to evaluate 15 buildings on Vodabashi Street.
So far, four trapped people have been rescued, five survivors have been found, and 25 severely collapsed buildings have been assessed for signs of life and risk.
The rescue team will adjust the rescue force according to the actual situation in the disaster area and the rescue situation on the scene, and will continue to carry out the rescue work in depth.

The rescue team obtained information about the rescue request from various sources, including embassies, local governments, and United Nations relief organizations, and verified each request through online inquiries, on-site searches, and other means.
The Chinese rescue team in Hong Kong was informed about the current rescue environment and the collapse of buildings, and jointly conducted search operations.

The Chinese team is currently jointly responsible for the regional coordination (SSC5) with the Italian rescue team, and has sent three team members to the Regional Rescue Coordination Center No. 5 to communicate with the Italian, British, Serbian, Slovak, and Oman teams, and to learn about the rescue work of the United Nations rescue organizations and national rescue teams.

The rescue team has continuously strengthened safety management and team security, and in accordance with the principle of "unified command, safety first", strengthened safety control at the rescue site, strengthened the requirements for rescue work discipline, and clarified safety precautions.
The system of rotation and guard duty is in operation, and the security management of the camp is strengthened.

The medical staff of the rescue team provides medical examination services for the team members every day, strengthens the medical protection of key personnel, and currently the rescue team is in good health, and conducts camp area eradication.

After the establishment of the camp, the logistics team set up 26 field tents in four categories, including command and communication, equipment storage, medical cleaning, living accommodation and dog shelters, and secured more than 30 sets of on-site rescue equipment.

The Biden administration on Friday (February 10) blacklisted six Chinese entities suspected of being involved in the spy balloon program.
The five Chinese companies and one research institute helped modernize the Chinese military, especially in aerospace projects, including airships and aircraft, the U.S. Commerce Department said.
Companies on the blacklist have difficulty obtaining US technology exports.
The list is known as the "entity list", and companies on it cannot purchase technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they have a special export permit from the U.S. Department of Commerce.

The companies included in the blacklist are Beijing Nanjiang Airspace Technology Co., Ltd., China Electronics Technology Group's 48th Research Institute, Dongguan Lingqu Remote Sensing Technology Co., Ltd., Taquan Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Taquan Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd.
The White House has previously said it is considering broader measures to "expose and address" China's larger surveillance activities that threaten U.S. national security.
The balloon incident sparked further tensions between China and the United States, and US Secretary of State Antony Blinken cancelled a visit to China.

The Chinese government has issued a serious and serious statement to the US Embassy in Beijing, criticizing the US efforts and processes that have seriously affected and damaged the stability of bilateral relations.

From the existing evidence of the wreckage and Chinese military procurement platform information, the US government concluded that the balloon manufacturer "had a direct relationship with the People's Liberation Army" and was an approved supplier to the Chinese military.

At a news conference on Friday, Foreign Ministry spokesman Ma Ying-jeou said that China has repeatedly clarified its position on the incident involving a Chinese airship that entered U.S. airspace by mistake due to force majeure.
According to the State Department website, she added that the relevant resolution of the US Congress was purely political manipulation and hype.
China is strongly displeased with this and firmly opposes it.

"Today's action demonstrates our collective efforts to identify and stop Chinese spy balloons that violate the airspace of the United States and more than 40 countries," said Matthew Axelrod, Assistant Secretary for Export Enforcement at the U.S. Department of Commerce.
Reuters reported that an employee of Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aircraft Technology Co., Ltd. said he had no knowledge of the sanctions and declined further comment.
The Chinese Embassy in the United States has not commented on the information.
(Reuters, etc.)

(Deutsche Welle) With days left to go before the earthquake strikes parts of Turkey and Syria, the hopes of finding survivors are dampening. But the rescue of a family of five on Saturday has given rescuers a boost.
The family of five was rescued after being trapped under the rubble for more than five days in Nurdayi village in the severely affected Gaziantep province, according to the Associated Press.
Rescuers first pulled the mother and daughter out of the rubble, then found the father, but he insisted that his son and another daughter be rescued first.
When they were all rescued, the crowd cheered.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaras, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old man were rescued in cold weather.
"What is it?"
"The boy trapped under the rubble for 129 hours asks rescuers to rescue him after being brought back to the surface".
A man in Kahramanmaras holds a cat he just rescued.
The miraculous success of the rescue brought a glimmer of hope to the already bleak search and rescue efforts, but at the same time, the number of victims continued to rise.
According to official figures, Monday's earthquake has killed more than 20,000 people in Turkey, and an estimated 3,500 in neighboring Syria.
Despite experts saying that people can survive trapped in the ruins for at most a week, the hopes of finding more survivors have become increasingly dim.
Rescuers are still searching for signs of life beneath the ruins using thermal imaging.
At the same time, the focus of the rescue effort began to shift to helping those survivors in desperate need.
UN officials: disaster "unseen in a century" in the region

The United Nations Under-Secretary-General for Humanitarian Affairs and Emergency Relief Coordinator Martin Griffiths described the earthquake as "the worst disaster in a century" in the region at a press conference in Turkey.
He also praised Turkey's response to the disaster as "exceptional".
He also told Reuters that he hoped relief would be delivered to areas under the control of both the Syrian government and the opposition, but that it was "not clear".
The United Nations pledged an additional $25 million in relief assistance to Syrian victims of the earthquake.
Earlier this week, the UN announced a $25 million aid package for Turkey and Syria.
The most devastating earthquake in 60 years.
The Great Chile Earthquake (1960)
The 1960 Valdivia earthquake was a major earthquake that occurred on May 22, 1960, at 3:11 p.m. local time, in Valdivia, Chile.
In just ten minutes, the entire city of Valdivia was in ruins.
The earthquake was followed by a tsunami that hit the coast of Chile, causing a 25-meter high wave.
The tsunami reached far away Japan and the Philippines.
The exact number of deaths and economic losses caused by a disaster of this magnitude is unknown.
The most devastating earthquake in 60 years.
The Great Alaska Earthquake (1964)
March 27, 1964, was a Friday, also known as Good Friday.
The largest earthquake in North American history occurred in Alaska, United States, on this day, with a magnitude of 9.2.
The Great Alaska Earthquake was the third largest earthquake on record until 2006.
At the time of the earthquake, a fault between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate broke off near Prince William Sound near the Academy Fjord.
In most areas, the earthquake lasted between three and five minutes.
The seabed shift triggered a huge tsunami, 67 meters high.
As it was a holiday, schools and many businesses were closed.
The earthquake ultimately killed 139 people.
Nine people died directly from the earthquake, and 130 others died from the tsunami that followed.
The most devastating earthquake in 60 years.
The Great Tangshan Earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, Tangshan City and Funan County in Hebei Province, China, were struck by two earthquakes of magnitude 7 or greater within 16 hours.
The earthquake center was 23 kilometers from the ground.
The entire city of Tangshan was devastated, with traffic, communications, water and electricity supplies interrupted.
The capital Beijing was also severely affected, 140 km away.
According to official statistics, the earthquake killed 242,769 people and injured 164,851 in all affected areas, including Beijing and Tianjin.
The earthquake is the second deadliest earthquake recorded in China, after the 1556 Jiajing earthquake.
However, some scientists estimate that the earthquake may have killed at least 650,000 people.
The most devastating earthquake in 60 years.
Indian Ocean earthquake (2004)
On 26 December 2004, an earthquake of magnitude 9.1 to 9.3 occurred 160 km (100 mi) west of the coast of Aceh, Indonesia.
The earthquake triggered a huge tsunami with waves reaching 15 to 30 meters in height.
A total of 14 countries along the Pacific coast were affected, with the worst impacts being in Aceh, Indonesia, the resorts of Phuket and Koh Lipe, Thailand, Sri Lanka, and Tamil Nadu, India.
The tsunami swept away many tourists and locals who were enjoying their holidays on the beaches and working on the seashore, and many people were missing.
The number of deaths and missing is estimated at at least 300,000.
The most devastating earthquake in 60 years.
The Great Wenchuan Earthquake (2008)
On May 12, 2008, a major earthquake occurred in Wenchuan, Sichuan, China.

According to the Chinese Earthquake Bureau, the magnitude of the earthquake was 8.2 on the Richter scale and 8.3 on the moment magnitude scale, and the damaged area was more than 100,000 square kilometers.
As of 25 September 2008, the earthquake had killed 69,227 people, left 17,923 missing, injured 374,643 people, and left 19,930,300 people homeless.
It was the most devastating earthquake in the People's Republic of China since the Tangshan earthquake in 1931.
In March 2009, the State Council of China declared May 12 as the annual Disaster Prevention and Reduction Day, to strengthen public education and attention to disaster prevention and reduction.
Since then, many Chinese governments and schools have held earthquake drills on this day every year.
Primary and secondary schools have also begun to pay attention to the dissemination of earthquake mitigation education.
The most devastating earthquake in 60 years.
Haiti earthquake (2010)
On January 12, 2010, Haiti was struck by a 7.0 magnitude earthquake.
The epicenter was located 25 km southwest of Port-au-Prince, Haiti, and the earthquake originated at a depth of 13 km.
The International Red Cross estimates that the earthquake affected approximately 3 million people.
The Haitian government issued a confirmed death toll of over 200,000.
In some areas of Haiti, as many as 90% of the houses were destroyed.
Despite massive aid and support from the international community, the overpopulated, corrupt and impoverished country never recovered from the disaster.
The most devastating earthquake in 60 years.
2011 Tohoku earthquake
On March 11, 2011, a large earthquake of magnitude 9.0 occurred off the coast of Tohoku Prefecture, Japan.
The epicenter was located in the Pacific Ocean east of Miyagi Prefecture's capital city, Sendai, and the depth of the earthquake source was measured to be 24 km (15 mi).
This was the first earthquake of magnitude 9 or greater to be recorded in Japan.
About 22,000 people died and about 400,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant was affected by the earthquake and tsunami, and a leakage accident occurred.
The accident was classified as a Category 7 on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES).
The Fukushima accident resulted in trace amounts of radioactive material being measured around the world, including iodine-131 and cesium-137 (half-life 30 years).
Large amounts of radioactive isotopes were released into the Pacific Ocean as a result of the accident.
According to the United Nations, at least 870,000 people are in dire need of food in the regions affected by the conflict.
In Syria alone, 5.3 million people were displaced by the earthquake.
The World Food Programme (WFP) is appealing for $77 million to provide food to people displaced by the earthquake in Turkey and Syria.
Currently, the temperature in the disaster area is below freezing, and many victims have no shelter.
The Turkish government distributed large quantities of hot meals, tents and blankets, but these supplies remained difficult to reach many of those in need.
In Syria, which has been mired in civil war for 12 years, the earthquake has added to the suffering of the people.
Within four days of the earthquake, the World Food Programme had delivered food aid to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization sent 72 tons of medical supplies for trauma and emergency surgery.
(AP, Reuters, etc.)

Xi Jinping wrote back to encourage the Chinese medical teams to use their talents and their hearts to benefit the people there and to tell the Chinese story in action.

Beijing, Feb. 10 (Xinhua) -- On February 9, Xi Jinping, Secretary General of the Communist Party of China (CPC), President of the State Council and Chairman of the Central Military Commission, sent a letter to the members of the 19th Chinese medical team to assist the Central African Republic, greeting them and the entire medical team and expressing his fervent hopes.

In his reply, Xi said that you have overcome the difficulties of working life in China and Africa, and served the people there with your hearts, being both white-coated angels who save lives and heal wounds, and messengers of friendship who convey friendship.
