I hope that you will not forget your beginnings and keep your mission in mind, and vigorously promote the spirit of Chinese medical teams, which is not afraid of hardship, willing to give, save lives and help injured, and show great love without borders, and that you will benefit local people with your kindness and skill, and tell the story of China with practical actions, and make greater contributions to the promotion of the construction of the human health community
Medical aid abroad is an important part of our foreign aid work.
In 1963, China sent its first medical team to Algeria.

Over the past 60 years, China has sent 30,000 medical teams to 76 countries and regions in Africa, Asia, the Americas, Europe and Oceania, treating 290 million patients, and winning widespread international recognition.
Currently, the Aid to the Church in Need is working in 115 medical sites in 56 countries, nearly half of which are in remote and difficult areas.

Singapore's tourism industry is recovering strongly, with incoming tourists expected to be 19 times more than in 2021.

SGTO, 11 Jan (Xinhua) -- The Singapore Tourism Board (STB) recently announced that it expects to welcome 12 million to 14 million international tourists to Singapore in 2023, bringing about S$18 billion to S$21 billion in tourism revenue. STB said that tourist arrivals and tourism revenue will recover to about 67% to 75% of the pre-COVID
The Singapore tourism market will gradually restart and recover by 2022.

The Singapore Tourism Board recently released statistics showing that incoming tourists in 2022 will increase 19-fold from 330,600 in 2021 to 6.3 million, exceeding the Board's earlier estimate of 4 million to 6 million, and tourists have recovered to 33% of the pre-pandemic level.

Singapore’s tourism revenue totaled S$8.96 billion from January to September 2022, and is expected to reach S$13.8 billion to S$14.3 billion for the full year of 2022, up from S$1.89 billion in 2021, a six- to seven-fold increase, and has recovered to pre-COVID-19 levels of around 50
The Singapore government has taken a number of measures to accelerate the recovery of tourism.
In April 2022, the government announced a budget of nearly S$500 million to stimulate the tourism sector.
The Tourism Board recently announced plans to spend S$110 million from this budget over the next two years to launch more commercial and leisure activities to attract returning tourists.

In order to make health and wellness a major tourist attraction in Singapore, the Singapore Tourism Board issued a call for proposals on 23 November 2022 for the development of a health and wellness destination on the south coast of Singapore.

Wang Ling Li, Executive Director of Sports and Wellness Tourism at the Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have put health at the forefront of their considerations.

The development of a health and wellness destination in the South Coast, with its Bay Gardens and Marina Bay Sands, is expected to contribute to Singapore's tourism and economy, as visitors spend and stay longer in Singapore.
Health and wellness will become an important part of Singapore's tourism product in the coming years, said Tourism Singapore Director Chen Jianlong.
The COVID-19 pandemic has raised public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
For this reason, the Tourism Board has been promoting health and wellness programs to the local public and international tourists for the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board will host its first ever Health Festival, offering the public 130 different health activities and experiences.
Singapore will continue to offer new travel experiences to visitors.

In addition to the newly opened Singapore Children's Museum, the Avatar World at Marina Bay Sands, the Central Beach Market at Sentosa, the new "Exploring New Territories" exhibition hall at the Museum of Arts and Sciences, and the new open-air theater at the Night Safari Zoo, the Tourism Board will support the development and updating of the Bird Park at the World of Wildlife and make Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

Singapore is planning to develop industry standards for sustainable development of the meetings, conventions and rewards tourism industry by 2023, and to focus on improving waste management and carbon emissions to further improve the tourism environment.
The recovery of Singapore's tourism industry accelerated the recovery of the aviation industry.

The data shows that as of December 18, 2022, the passenger traffic at Changi Airport has recovered strongly, with 150,000 passengers per day, about 1 million passengers per week, which is about 75% of the pre-COVID-19 level, and the number of aviation employees on duty has also recovered to about 90% of the pre-pandemic level.
The data show that from January to October 2022, Singapore has received 23.6 million passengers, equivalent to 42% of pre-COVID-19, and 170,000 flights, 53% of pre-pandemic.
The rapid recovery of tourism has also led to a recovery in accommodation, transportation, food and beverage, and shopping.
Singapore’s government and tourism industry have high hopes for the Chinese market.

According to Ko Suk Tan, Assistant Director of the International Division of the Singapore Tourism Board, a survey by China Travel Platform shows that Singapore's safety index is among the top three in the world, which is one of the reasons why Singapore is popular with Chinese tourists.
Before the COVID-19 pandemic, about 3.6 million Chinese traveled to Singapore for holidays every year.
With China's easing of border policies, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists will recover to 30-60% of 2019 this year.
Ko said that the Bureau will closely monitor the signals China will release on its outbound travel policy to respond to changes in tourist demand.

In addition to strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies such as Traveloka, the Singapore Tourism Board will actively prepare to welcome Chinese tourists in response to the new trends in Chinese travel abroad.

Looking ahead to the 2023 tourism market, the STB is confident that the tourism industry will recover faster than expected, provided that the global economy does not experience a significant recession that impacts public revenues, and that there are no new large-scale and fatal outbreaks.

Q: How do you view the US January non-farm employment data, which exceeded expectations, and future trends?

A: On February 3, the US Department of Labor released January 2023 non-farm employment data, with 517,000 new non-farm jobs, significantly higher than the market's 189,000 expected; unemployment fell to 3.4%, the lowest level in nearly 50 years; hourly wages rose by 4.4% year-on-year,

From the total, the data has many one-time and technical factors disturbances, such as strike returning teachers, the revision of the survey statistical gauge, seasonal factor update, subsequently may be revised (refer to January 2022 new non-farm from 504,000 down to 364,000 people), non-farm employment or not as strong as the data reflects.

From a structural perspective, the impact of layoffs in high-tech enterprises is still present, but its share is relatively low; new jobs in high-contact services such as leisure hotels, education and health care have recovered sharply, and the data show that the labour force gap in the service sector remains.

Combined with similarly large and above-expected services PMI, job vacancy and labor gap data recovery, and strong consumer credit data, we judge that the US services sector is recovering quickly from the extreme weather and holidays.
We believe that supply and demand tensions in the US job market will not improve without a recession.

The US labor market currently has a supply gap of more than 500,000, and labor participation rates are rising slowly, especially for those aged 25-54, whose labor participation rates are close to pre-pandemic highs.
In addition, the impact of austerity on the job market will be further delayed by strong consumer demand, driven by the excess savings and consumer credit of US residents.
Continued supply-demand tensions in the US job market will be the underlying theme of the US economy in 2023.
In addition to the end of the current interest rate hike and the repeatedly changing inflation expectations, we are not optimistic about the continued slowdown in wage growth.
Before the data release, the US equity and bond markets were overly optimistic about the Fed's path to interest rate hikes.

With the continued improvement of inflation data, the Fed has been shortening the pace of interest rate hikes while maintaining a fragile balance of market inflation expectations, but the market has ignored the Fed's falcon-like statements, not only expecting to stop the rate hike early, but also expecting two rate cuts at the end of the year.

Given the tight supply and demand in the labor market and the uncertain impact of austerity, we believe the Fed's guidance for interest rate hikes at the end of the year is relatively reasonable, and extreme market adjustments and trading crowds will probably cause some harm to the market.

However, the stubborn wage growth rate is difficult to change the current rapid decline in inflation, with the M2 data year-on-year negative and the various CPI sub-item leading indicators gradually improved, since October, the US CPI data has shifted to the rapid decline phase, the stubborn wage growth rate will only form a base for the future inflation data, the current market expectations are difficult to verify, after

"E-Account" for Funds: Securities and Exchange Commission Authorized Development of All Funds under Investor Names - Economic Observer - Professional Financial News Website
The 2014 report of the Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) found that the number of fund purchase channels is 1,000.
"Always forget the safe?"
These problems of the Christians are about to be solved.
On February 10, the Securities and Exchange Commission announced that the Fund E Account app will be available in various mobile app stores and will be openly tested.

It was introduced that "Fund E Account" provides individual investors with public fund account and share information "one-stop" query service, aimed at solving the forget account, query complexity and other industry service pain points of small and medium-sized investors.

According to Wind data, by the end of 2022, there will be 156 domestic publicly traded fund managers, managing funds of about 26 trillion yuan; 167 publicly traded fund share registration institutions, and 411 publicly traded fund sales institutions.
The accounting systems of the various share registration agencies are independent from each other, and there is no unified inquiry channel for the industry.
Industry people said that at the end of 2021, more than 720 million Chinese fund investors, that is, half of the country invested in fund products.

Previously, investors had to inquire about their purchases through different sales agencies, but now they can inquire about their purchases through all sales channels through the "Fund E Account" and keep track of their fund holdings.
What is the Fund E Account App?

According to the relevant document, the "Fund E Account" app is a mobile application developed by China Securities and Exchange Commission, which can provide investors with a one-stop query for the off-market holdings of publicly traded funds.

Investors can easily and quickly control their holdings of OTC shares of publicly traded fund products owned by various fund managers purchased through various sales channels in the market through the "Fund E Account", which improves the efficiency of querying.

Specifically, investors can access information on fund accounts opened with public fund managers across the market, trading accounts opened with public fund sales organizations, and off-exchange holdings of products including publicly traded securities investment funds and collective asset management plans with a number of investors not limited to 200, which are managed by securities companies, through the Fund E Account.

Liu Yichen, head of the Shanghai Securities Fund Evaluation Research Center, told the Economic Observer that investors can use the "Fund E Account" app to know all their OTC fund holdings, help them find "forgotten assets", and more importantly, the app provides a full account information collection for clients to help them better understand their investment situation in a timely, accurate and complete manner, thus improving their portfolio configura
How to register?

The reporter noted that at present, the "fund e account" app has been listed in Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, vivo and other mobile app stores, but the app is still in the public trial phase, registration requires filling in an invitation code, investors can contact the fund manager of the fund they hold.

A customer service representative of a large-scale publicly traded fund in Shanghai gave the reporters of Economic Observer a 6-digit invitation code, and told the reporters, "During the trial phase of the app, China Securities will provide a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager.
After the trial run, the invitation code will not be required for open user registration.

The reporters registered and checked the account by downloading and using the documentation for the "Fund E Account" published on the official website of the Securities and Exchange Commission. The entire process took only a few minutes and was divided into four steps: user registration, real name verification, fund account linking, and fund check.

After verifying the real name, press the "Asset" fund link button, and all the fund products purchased by the reporter through the various fund sales platforms will be presented in the list of link options (accounts can be linked). After completing the link, the journalist can intuitively see the total assets of the fund and can start using the query function.
It is worth noting that the "Fund E Account" only provides information services to investors, and does not carry out redemption.
The data date displayed in the "Fund E Account" is generally three trading days forward from the date of the user's query (day T).
For example, if you open a Fund E account on February 10, the total assets, fund shares and net assets on the assets page will be displayed on February 7, three trading days ahead of that date.

After the meeting, the leaders of Fiji and Japan issued a joint statement stating that they will sign a trilateral defense agreement with the United States, conduct substantive defense exchanges, and oppose the Chinese Communist Party's hegemonic policy.

Marcos Jr. visited China in early January and signed deals worth $20 billion.

If a crisis arises in Taiwan, the US military may launch operations from bases in the Philippines.

Japanese media believe that Japan, Korea, Taiwan, Australia, and even the Philippines are now forming an axis with the United States, and are building an "arc against the CCP" in the Western Pacific to promote regional cooperation.

The Judicial Workers Union again mobilized against the government's pension reform proposals.

On Saturday (February 11), French trade unions once again launched a national mobilization against the government's draft pension reform, calling on people to take to the streets to express their opinions.
This is the fourth day of action in the social movement against the government's proposed pension reform.
How many people respond to the call for a rally may influence the next steps of the union group.
This is the fourth national mobilization in a month by the eight major French unions, and the first to be held on a Saturday.
Since Saturday is a public holiday for most French people, and they do not have to choose between a demonstration or a pay cut strike, the unions hope that today's rally will attract more people.

The unions of the public bus system, subway and public railway companies have not called for strikes today. The public bus system should be able to operate normally, and citizens can travel to the rally site by car. At the same time, in the areas where schools have started winter holidays, people can start their holidays normally.

Union groups hoped to see more than a million people at the rally today, while police expected a national turnout of between 600,000 and 800,000, with 90,000 to 120,000 people expected in central Paris.

Since the protests against the government's pension reform plan began, the number of people taking to the streets has been decreasing, despite polls showing that a majority of French people do not support raising the legal retirement age from 62 to 64.
The first strike demonstrations on 31 January brought together between 1.27 million and 2.5 million people across the country.
The demonstrations on Tuesday (February 7) have shrunk to between 757,000 and 2 million people across the country.
The pension reform is currently being discussed in the French National Assembly.
The opposition, especially the radical left, submitted numerous amendments, so that the process of deliberation was very slow.
The dispute between Asano and Ishii grew increasingly heated.

A member of the radical left-wing party France Insoumise recently posted a photo of himself stepping on a balloon with the head of the Labour Minister on it on social media, prompting protests from the ruling party.
The Speaker of the National Assembly eventually announced that the member would be banned from parliamentary activities for 15 days as a punishment for such behaviour.

Despite the reforms' potential to trigger the largest social upheaval in France in more than 20 years, the government has not made any major concessions to date, although it has made minor adjustments to the draft.
The unions are preparing to take action again on Thursday, March 16, and they plan to organize demonstrations on March 7, when the bill is discussed in the Senate.
China encourages higher fertility, and invites sperm donors to universities, with high standards of quality.

On September 9, the Yunnan Human Sperm Bank in China issued a notice requesting that people with a university degree or higher or students who donate sperm 8 to 12 times successfully receive a subsidy of RMB 4,500.

According to the Taiwan media today, the message was searched on Weibo on the day, and triggered follow-up initiatives in many provinces and cities such as Zhejiang, Shanxi, Hubei, Shandong and Beijing.
According to the Free Times, China encourages university students to donate sperm.

The highest threshold for donation is in Beijing, where, in addition to education, the donor must be at least 170 cm tall, have a good appearance, no visible hair loss, and a myopia of no more than 600 degrees.

According to the report, the Yunnan Human Sperm Bank said that sperm donors can receive a full male medical examination worth 1,000 yuan, "especially sperm and chromosome testing, most people have never done, and to know their fertility status is significant."
The donor conditions include: height of 165 cm or more, university degree or higher, color blindness, hepatitis B and other genetic and infectious diseases.

The report quoted Chinese Tianmu News reports that the human sperm bank in Shaanxi Province has printed a poster with the slogan "paid sperm donation, unlimited glory", calling on young people to respond to sperm donation, and encouraging netizens to forward the related message, "let the love spread".
The price in Shanxi is higher than in Yunnan, and those who qualify can receive 300 yuan in cash each time, and those who complete a certain number of donations can receive a subsidy of 5,000 yuan.
The highest price is in Beijing, with a maximum subsidy of 5,150 yuan.
The last communist chancellor of East Germany dies today.
The successor of the Communist Party of East Germany reported in a statement from the party, "Last night Hans Modrow left us at the age of 95.
As a result, our party has lost an important leader.
On 13 November 1989, four days after the Berlin Wall, which had separated East and West Berlin for 28 years, was opened, Moder said he would help turn East Germany into a democratic country.
At that time, the Communist Party leaders were forced to resign as protesters across East Germany demanded democracy and freedom.
After the Soviet Union's fall, Mikhail Gorbachev called for changes in Soviet-dominated Eastern Europe.
In March 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free elections in the German Democratic Republic (GDR).
The election resulted in his resignation as Prime Minister.
Despite his reforms, opponents accused him of trying to delay political change and unification, which occurred in October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to restructure rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, ModroÃ±o was convicted of electoral fraud in the May 1989 municipal elections, but did not go to jail.
It is alleged that the charges were politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, Moder continued to serve in the German Bundestag, and from 1999 to 2004, he was a member of the European Parliament.
Modroń saw himself as a reformer and wanted to change the Communist Party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters that he did not want a return to the old East Germany, but that the achievements of the former GDR should be recognized.
Born in 1928 in the then German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica in Poland), Modrow was trained as a mechanic.

During World War II, he was the leader of a youth fire brigade and, towards the end of the conflict, became a member of the Volkssturm, a Nazi militia that conscripted men aged 16 to 60 to fight in the final days of the war.
At the age of 17, Modrow was captured by the Soviet army and taken to the Soviet Union as a prisoner of war, where he attended anti-fascist courses and became a committed Communist.
In 1949, the year East Germany was founded, he returned to Germany and found a job as a mechanic, while continuing his studies in social sciences and economics, which he finished with a PhD.

Modro was a staff member of the Free German Youth Movement, which almost all East German youth joined, and rose through the ruling Social Democratic Union Party (SED) to become chairman of the Dresden regional party between 1973 and 1989.
He also served in the East German parliament for over 30 years.
In 1990, Modro became the de facto leader of East Germany, holding the highest state office.
Iran marks anniversary of revolution, hackers hacked presidential speech in support of protests.

The Islamic Republic of Iran held an official rally on Saturday to commemorate the 44th anniversary of the Iranian Revolution, but anti-government hackers briefly interrupted President Ibrahim Raisi's televised address.
The live TV broadcast of the president's speech was interrupted on the Internet for about a minute, when a group of anti-government hackers named "Edalat Ali" (Justice Ali) appeared on the screen.

Protests across the country continue in Iran after the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in custody of the country's morality police in September.

The Iranian security forces have cracked down on protests with lethal force, one of the most powerful challenges the Islamic Republic has faced since the 1979 revolution overthrew a 2,500-year-old monarchy.

As part of an amnesty commemorating the anniversary of the revolution, the Iranian authorities released on Friday the imprisoned dissidents Farhad Mesami and the Iranian-French scholar Fariba Adelhaj, who were on hunger strike.
Earlier, the Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, issued an amnesty decree, which included some of the prisoners arrested during the recent anti-government protests.

(God is great!)

"The Death of the Islamic Republic" in a video posted on social media.

President Lacy's speeches were often interrupted by the slogan "America die"—a signature slogan of state rallies.
The crowd also shouted "Israel die".
Adelkhah, who has been in prison since 2019, is one of seven French nationals detained in Iran, a factor in the deterioration of relations between Paris and Tehran in recent months, Reuters said.

They then put her under house arrest, but in January she was back in prison.

The French Foreign Ministry on Friday welcomed Adelkhah's release, calling for her freedom to be restored, "including the right to return to France if she so wishes."
The balloon incident is more shiny American eyes?
Strengthening restrictions on technology exports to China
According to the Wall Street Journal today, after the balloon incident, the United States is preparing to tighten further technology exports to China.

Current and former security officials said the balloon incident highlighted the national security threat posed by China and would secure more political support for strengthening U.S. technology protection.
The United States claimed that the balloon carried antennas and sensors for intelligence gathering and communications.
According to Martijn Rasser, a former senior CIA official and now a researcher at the New American Security Center at the Washington think tank.
"This is undoubtedly pouring oil on the fire, supporting the view of the Chinese hardliners".

"We will also consider broader actions to expose and respond to China's increased surveillance activities, which pose a threat to our national security and to our allies and partners," White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre told reporters on Thursday.
US officials said they had notified the governments of more than 30 countries about the balloon incident, and that international coordination was essential to counter the Chinese threat.

In addition to the Biden administration's actions, the newly formed House Committee on Strategic Competition with China may also pressure the US to take tougher measures to slow China's development, said Emily Benso, a senior fellow at the Center for Strategic and International Studies.
Congressmen will feel increasing pressure to take a tougher stance, she said, which could force the White House to adopt tougher policies.

According to the Wall Street Journal, many of those who advocate stricter export controls are also pushing for an expansion of the scope of the controls to include industries such as artificial intelligence.
The US government has also developed a foreign investment review program to examine US investments abroad for potential national security threats from China.
Analysts say the White House may face calls to launch the program faster.
Tsunami Relief Night and Day
Since the earthquake struck Turkey and neighboring Syria, rescue teams from dozens of countries have worked day and night to rescue survivors buried under the ruins of thousands of buildings.
In the freezing temperatures, they often plead for silence as they struggle to hear any sound of life from the dilapidated concrete piles.
Two more women were rescued after surviving in the rubble for days, Reuters reported today.
However, the death toll from the earthquake rose to 24,150.
The Turkish death toll was 20,665, while Syrian deaths exceeded 3,500.

Monday's 7.8-magnitude earthquake, followed by several strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria, is the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan and nearing the 31,000 deaths in neighboring Iran in 2003.
A similarly powerful earthquake in northwestern Turkey in 1999 killed more than 17,000 people.
Rescuers rescued two women trapped for 122 hours under the rubble of a collapsed building in Turkey after the region's deadliest earthquake in 20 years, Turkish authorities said on Saturday.
Another injured man, identified as Masallah Cicek, 55, was rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building in Diyarbakir, the largest city in southeastern Turkey.
In freezing temperatures, rescuers often appeal for silence as they struggle to hear any sound of life from the dilapidated concrete piles.
In the Samandag district of Turkey, rescuers crouched under concrete slabs, whispering "Inshallah" -- "God bless" -- as they carefully reached into the rubble to rescue a 10-day-old baby.
He opens his eyes as baby YagÃ¼n Ulas is wrapped in a blanket and carried to the field hospital.
The video footage shows the rescuers taking his mother, who is dizzy and pale but still sober on a stretcher.
Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters overnight that 67 people had been rescued from the rubble in the past 24 hours, and that 31,000 rescue workers were deployed in the affected areas.
He said that about 80,000 people were being treated in hospitals, while 1.05 million people had been left homeless by the earthquake and were crowded into temporary shelters.
As many people lacked food in cold winter conditions, the public increasingly questioned the response of the leaders of both countries.
According to official Syrian media, Syrian President Bashar al-Assad traveled to a hospital in Aleppo with his wife Asma, reportedly his first visit to the disaster area since the earthquake.
Earlier, the World Food Programme said that its stocks in rebel-controlled northwestern Syria were running out, as the state of war complicated relief efforts.
On Friday, Erdoğan visited Turkey's Adana province, where he admitted that the government's response had not been as rapid as expected.
Opponents have taken this issue to attack Erdoğan, who is due to run for re-election in a vote on May 14, but which may be postponed due to the disaster.
Reuters said that anger over delays in delivering aid and initiating rescue efforts could affect the election.
Even before the earthquake, the vote was seen as the most difficult challenge to Erdoğan's 20-year rule.
Erdoğan called for unity and condemned what he called "negative movements for political gain".
Turkey's main opposition leader Kemal Kiliçdaroğlu criticized the government's response.
Critics said, "The earthquake was great, but worse than the earthquake was the lack of coordination, lack of planning, and incompetence."
Hanoi, Vietnam, Feb. 11 (VNA) - On the morning of February 11, Prime Minister Phan Minh Khai and his wife visited the University of Brunei Darussalam (UBD) during their visit to the country.
The University of Brunei is the largest centre of higher education and scientific research in Brunei, and is ranked third in the region.
The University of Brunei is one of the symbols of Vietnam-Brunei cooperation in education and training.
In July 2013, the University of Brunei Darussalam established a formal cooperation with FPT University of Vietnam, with English language training as the main area of cooperation.
In addition to English, French, Moral Education, Japanese and Korean, Vietnamese is taught at the university.
During his visit to the University of Brunei, Vietnamese Prime Minister Phan Minh Khai and his wife exchanged views with students of the Vietnamese language course.
Prime Minister Phan Minh Triet was pleased that more and more foreigners are learning Vietnamese, which will contribute to the promotion of Vietnamese cultural and human image in the world.

Prime Minister Phan Minh Khai expressed his confidence and hope that the Vietnamese language teaching team at the University of Brunei will grow stronger and stronger, and that the students of the Vietnamese language course will become more interested in Vietnamese, learn hard, and be able to use Vietnamese fluently soon, and become ambassadors of the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries.

Prime Minister Phan Minh Triet also took the opportunity to interact with Vietnamese students studying English at the FPT-UBD Global Center in Da Nang City via video conferencing to learn about their learning situation, especially during the pandemic.

Prime Minister Phan Minh Chính said that the cooperation between FPT University and UBD, especially the FPT-UBD Global Center, is a living symbol of the educational cooperation between Vietnam and Brunei.
He also hoped that the students of the center would make greater progress in their studies and make a positive contribution to the friendship and cooperation between Vietnam and China.

In discussions with the Minister of Education and the leaders of the University of Brunei, Prime Minister Phan Minh Khai praised the results of the cooperation between the two countries in education, including the cooperation between FPT University and the University of Brunei, and the inclusion of Vietnamese language in the curriculum of the University of Brunei.

Prime Minister Phan Minh Chính hoped that the University of Brunei would continue to focus on ensuring the quality of Vietnamese language teaching and further expand the size of Vietnamese language classes.

Prime Minister Phan Minh Chính also praised the positive results of the cooperation between the two countries on the basis of the Memorandum of Understanding on Education Cooperation signed in April 2014, and recommended that Brunei continue to provide more scholarships and effectively implement short-term exchange training programs such as the Global Discovery Programme and the Discovery Year.

Prime Minister Phan Minh Triet highly praised the establishment of the first branch of the University of Brunei in Southeast Asia in Vietnam; believed that the University will grow stronger in the region and the world; and further expanded the cooperation with Vietnamese universities.
On this occasion, Prime Minister and his wife planted a memorial tree on the campus of the University of Brunei Darussalam and left a message on the memorial book.

Prime Minister Phan Minh Triet wished the University of Brunei to continue to develop, contribute more and more to the educational system of Brunei, and develop deeper and broader cooperation with various educational and training institutions in Vietnam.
(Concluded)

What exactly is the "object" that was shot down over Alaska?
The speculations are many.
The U.S. military once again used its most advanced stealth jet, the F-22, to shoot down an unidentified object over Alaska on Friday afternoon.
The crash site was 10 miles off the coast of Alaska.
This was the second time in less than a week that the U.S. had shot down a flying object.
Last Saturday, a spy balloon from China was shot down near the coast of South Carolina, after drifting through U.S. airspace for several days.

The Pentagon said the second object that was shot down entered U.S. airspace for the first time on Thursday night, and was tracked by U.S. military personnel as it moved over northeastern Alaska at an altitude of 40,000 feet (12,000 m).
The Pentagon also believes that there is no evidence that the object is manoeuvrable.

White House National Security Council Strategic Communications Coordinator John Corby said on Friday that while the exact nature of the high-altitude object was not clear, it "possessed a reasonable threat to the safety of civil aircraft."
According to Corby, unlike the spy balloon found in the United States, the object had no "payload" suspended from it.
Corby said, "We call it an 'object' as best we can describe it at this time."
President Biden had listened to the advice of the Pentagon before ordering the object to be shot down, and he had taken the decision "very carefully," Corby added.
The official U.S. description of the object was roughly summarized as: the size of a small car, no joystick, no suspension, and flying at an altitude of about 10,000 meters.
But this information does not answer basic questions, such as what the object is, which country it belongs to, or what mission it is performing.
Many online analysis and speculation suggest that this may be another Chinese balloon.

It may have come from China, as did the spy balloon that invaded US airspace and the Chinese balloon that hovered over Latin America, and they were performing some kind of mission in different locations.
The "object" in Alaska has also been linked to "unknown flying objects" (UFOs).
A report in US Weekly quoted former U.S. Representative Peter Meijer as tweeting on Friday that "I hope this 'unidentified flying object' is also a spy balloon, not a legitimate UFO."
"The irony of mixing alien spaceships with weather balloons is surprising, but it's not worth triggering an interstellar collision," said Major.
Major tweeted shortly after Corby confirmed that the object in Alaska had been shot down.
Newsweek said that it was not only Major who suspected the object to be a UFO.

Republican Rep. Tim Burchett of Tennessee criticized the government's cover-up of intelligence last month, calling for the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) to release a report on "unidentified flying objects."

It was a long time ago, and I was just reading it.
The book is more a collection of fragments of life about love than a collection of short stories.
The book is extremely light, as light as the white water, the words and sentences are extremely simplistic, and the plot is like the streets in a summer afternoon, quiet and light.
Each short story is a silhouette of a short moment in ordinary life, without beginning or ending.
Finally, they were collected together and titled What We Talk About When We Talk About Love.

I think that this novel, and its title, as a form of performance art, the author wants to express that love is not only the sad and happy on the stage, the sea of urban legends, and not just you and I, as glue, love is not only above and should not be represented by the above, love is also life as water, dull and tasteless day after day, and there is no measure to life, the escape from
As you read this book, you may think of quarreling couples around you, of the dull marriages of people you know, and of unfulfilled love.

That is why I do not recommend reading it, from an aesthetic point of view, the writing and plot are tasteless, unless your life is scary or sweet as living in a candy castle, otherwise you have to read the feeling is strange and boring.

In terms of depth of thought, the daily plot does not open one's mind or expand one's horizon (unlike Marx's Love in the Time of Cholera), and the short scenes do not explore any questions such as what mistakes lead to love failure.
What are the causes of the breakdown of the protagonist's marriage?
So I don't recommend reading this book, it doesn't matter.
The author's ideas are expressed more through technique and style than through plot, which is also why the reading experience is not as good.

I want to know what you think.
The first factor in determining a person's job satisfaction is not the amount of money they earn, but whether they are given enough attention and appreciation in their work.
According to Maslow's hierarchy of needs, after the basic survival needs are met, the most urgent needs are psychological needs—the desire to be understood, acknowledged, and appreciated.
In fact, for the Chinese, most of the time, "love you is hard to say," even if they have love, gratitude, and praise, they keep it in their hearts and do not say it.
In this book, the author describes five languages of appreciation: affirmative words, careful moments, acts of service, thoughtful gifts, and physical touch.

I don't think it's important that you know what the five languages of appreciation are, but that you can use them to express appreciation and gratitude to those around you, whether it's family, friends or colleagues.
The more we appreciate and appreciate the more we need to be, so that our lives will become better.
Learning to appreciate, the company can also retain talent to a certain extent, reduce the resignation rate.
Thank you for bringing us wonderful foreign ideas and world.

Because of the Chinese and Western cultural background, there are more or less differences between the languages, and if you have the opportunity to see the author's original version, you will gain more.
Thanks again to the authors and translators and to the editors for their hard work!
